definition: (after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: They returned to the store with other protesters day after day.
sentences.chinese: 他们与其他抗议者日复一日的来到这个餐馆。

sentences.english: At least one-thousand protesters rallied for the final day of the convention.
sentences.chinese: 在大会的最后一天，至少有一千名抗议者举行集会。

sentences.english: Tanks rumbled down the streets of Deraa, trying to seize the city back from protesters.
sentences.chinese: 坦克驶进德拉的街头，试图抓获回城的抗议者。

sentences.english: Protesters in August forced the closing of a chemical plant in Dalian.
sentences.chinese: 八月，抗议者们迫使大连一家化工厂关闭。

sentences.english: Protesters took over the roof of the building.
sentences.chinese: 抗议者接着占据了建筑的最高处。

sentences.english: Mr Dlamini said the protesters urged the government not to cut health spending.
sentences.chinese: 米尼说，抗议者们就是想敦促政府不能削减医疗费用。

sentences.english: Police fired  water cannon to  halt the protesters.
sentences.chinese: 警察用防爆水枪阻止抗议者前进。

sentences.english: In the meantime, the protesters are still milling about.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，抗议者还在原地打转。

sentences.english: President Bush's remarks were disrupted several times by shouting protesters.
sentences.chinese: 布希总统的讲话几次被高喊口号的抗议者打断。

sentences.english: They laid their objections to paper in a document called the Flushing Remonstrance.
sentences.chinese: 抗议者起草了一份文件，称为《法拉盛抗议书》。

sentences.english: Also pay attention to views being expressed by protestors or nongovernmental organisations.
sentences.chinese: 你还应该注意抗议者或者非政府组织表达的观点。

sentences.english: They stress the need to placate protesters rather than respond with force.
sentences.chinese: 这一方针更强调安抚抗议者，而非以暴制暴。

sentences.english: One protestor said that removing the video was an attack on the American people.
sentences.chinese: 一名抗议者说，取消影片是对美国人民的攻击。

sentences.english: In Hong Kong this week, protesters are burning cardboard cutouts of iPhones.
sentences.chinese: 本周，已有抗议者在香港焚烧纸质iPhone面板。

sentences.english: Protesters slept in the open air or underneath tarps.
sentences.chinese: 抗议者可以睡在露天或防水油布下面。

sentences.english: An anti-free trade protester stands in front of the Japanese Embassy in Bangkok, April 3, 2007.
sentences.chinese: 反自由贸易的抗议者站在泰国曼谷的日本大使馆前。

definition: Netanyahu (name)/Benjamin Netanyahu (1949-), Israeli Likud politician, prime minister 1996-1999 and from 2009
